title: Variation
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA. Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, by October 25, 1951 until November 1, 1951 [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, November 1951.

Notes:
[1]. The lithograph appears on a list of works received at Carnegie Institute as possible gifts on October 25, 1951. Mrs. Beal's notation on a subsequent list of 1951 gifts to Carnegie Institute, suggests that she purchased it for $45. The lithograph was accessioned by Carnegie Institute on November 1, 1951.
